body.p: Management should include forward‑looking information when it is aware of trends, uncertainties or other factors that could affect the entity’s liquidity, capital resources, revenues and the results of its operations. Such information should focus on the extent to which the entity’s financial position, liquidity and performance may change in the future and why, and include management’s assessment of the entity’s prospects in the light of current period results. Management should provide forward‑looking information through narrative explanations or through quantified data, which may—but are not required to—include projections or forecasts. Management should disclose the assumptions used in providing forward‑looking information.
